ratings.comment: If you are interested in only talking about Africa and Sharon Hutchinson for an entire semester, than this is the class for you. This class was completely biased towards only Hutchinson's opinions and is a complete waste of time. The only saving grace was my wonderful TA, Sarah who should have been given a raise for putting up with Sharon...

Very **** and advances her own agenda.  She spent class time discussing her own economic views.  The class was not understandible and the tests covered specific material in text or irrelivent topics you would not think to study.  Terrible teacher and it seemed to rub off on some TAs. However my TA Meg was Awesome!!

Let's start with her accent...can anyone pinpoint where exactly it originates from? Probably not because she made it up. Moving on to the class portion....her lectures are long and contain zero information about the course. If you enjoy hearing arrogant people talking about themselves then by all means, take the class. If not, take the other one.
She's retired now, which is probably for the best.

Prof. Hutchinson is by far the worst professor I have had at this university. Her lectures are completely incomprehensible and unstructured. The exams are ridiculous. This class should be called Sharon Hutchinson 101 because that's just about all she talks about. Even her accent is uncalled for.
Sharon's investment and interest in her students is low. She's not at all approachable.

TERRIBLE. Very unorganized, rude and hardly lectures herself. Every day, you will learn about a new topic and it turns into one big jumble of useless information. The books are boring but they ARE on the exams so read them carefully. There is a 5 page paper to write and bi-weekly response papers on the books. But overall, try to avoid 277.

The worst professor I have ever had here at UW. She has more guest lectures/films than lectures herself, which is actually a good thing because she's so bad. The content of the class should be interesting and she clearly knows a lot about what she's talking about, but she presents it so terribly that it's not even worth attending lecture.

I'm pretty sure that the only person that would praise this prof. here is Sharon herself.  Her pretentious attitude and agonizingly fake British accent, along with her disorganized, opinionated lectures make this the worst class/professor I have had since coming to the UW.  I am hoping that her time as a paid instructor is close to its end.

I am taking her class right now and I can barely stand to go to class. I was interested in African before this class, but her un organized lectures and fake pretentious British accent made me not want to learn about African at all. She was rude to both the students and guest lecturers.

Never took her classes, but had as a guest lecturer twice.  Her accent is distracting.  It sounds like an American TRYING to sound arrogantly British.  And that's exactly how she seems: arrogant.  Besides that, she makes an interesting topic so boring she might as well have been reading a dictionary.  I'm sure she's great.  I just don't think so.

This was one of the most unorganized classes I have been a part of since coming to UW. She clearly knows a lot about Africa, but she focuses most of the class on Sudan and you miss out on some of the most important countries in Africa. For how hard I worked, I felt like I took little from the class considering how interesting the material is.

Sharon taught an extremely interesting Anthro 120 class! It worked for her because it was a smaller group, there weren't really any exams, and she could basically talk about whatever she wanted. An extremely interesting person, but I agree that she probably does better outside the lecture hall
She's not organized at all. There is little fluidity or clarity concering her lectures. She skips from one topic to the next consistently.

RANDOM.Completely random and all over the place in every lecture. She told many stories, which kept lecture somewhat interesting, but had no relevance to exam content. Overall she was someone who has accomplished a lot, all of which you will hear about, but found lectures hard to follow. She lectures quickly, so take good notes.

I'll go ahead and agree with the few previous posts in earnest. She definitely is qualified to teach this course, and brings in a great selection of guest speakers. That being said, her lectures are painful. She lectures extremely quickly, I tried my very best to write down notes, but admittedly missed a lot. I would however still recommend 277.

Despite a few interesting stories, Sharon was not a good lecturer by any means. Class was unorganized and boring, fortunately Ingram had comfy seats to nap in.  She was rude not only to students, but to the guest lecturers, who she often interrupted.  Also, she spoke in a fake accent.  I think she's from Kentucky...

I was interested in taking this class because I didn't know much about Africa, unfortunately, I still don't know much.  This was by far my least favorite class so far in college.  Sharon had some interesting stories, yes, but she was an awful teacher.  Not only did the lectures lack direction and organization, they were usually really boring.

Sharon is an inspiration to all and a phenomenal instructor. Her extensive fieldwork and research qualifies her beyond reason to teach about africa, especially the Nuer. While her lectures get a bit confusing, you can feel her passion and excitement when she is talking. I would recommend the course as it inspired me to major in African Studies.

Interesting material but lectures lack direction. Tough to grasp the main ideas without any visual aids. Sharon has more bad days than good days. Be cautious with your computer usage in class, she will call you out if you are on an inaproperiate website. Fairly rude woman, but don't let it deter you from taking the class if Africa interests you.

Ok, this class sucked, but not without Hutchinson trying. I frankly think the idea of a survey of Africa is impossible to execute, but she tried. However, she used too many guest lecturers, interrupted them and then gave no direction for what would be on the test. Oh, but the paper is a joke. 94 for an hours work. tread lightly.

I thought she was a great teacher...she has a lot of cool stories from working in Sudan.  Sometimes the class got confusing because of all the guest lecturers, but it was a fairly comprehensive look at Africa.  I would take this class!

Lectures were interesting (and she mixed things up by allowing a bunch of guest lectures), but I wasn't a big fan of her attitude and exam structure. Take the class, because it's great, but don't expect her to enhance it all that much.

Lectures were very hard to follow with her scattered notes. Overly arrogant and large workload for the part she teaches. Hard to get a hold of outside of class. Exam difficult. I'm sure she is a great humanitarian but her skills are lacking as a professor.
An amazing professor and human being.  Great teaching style split between lecturing, opening the floor for discussions, and integrating video.
Very interesting teacher. During the summer the readings can be a little intense. Overall not too bad.
boring class.  course has no structure.  she talks a lot about herself and self experiences that are not included on the test.  Tests are very hard!
Didn't have a clue what she was talking about.  Mostly just talked about her own experiences which aren't on the exam.
No Comments
ridiculously bad teacher, didnt learn a thing,  hard to hear, hard to understand... real thankful its a team taught class
Went to all of her lectures, I had no idea what she lectured on. The whole class had issues with her.
terrible... cant understand here, cant hear here, accent is bad, topics boring, fell asleep everyday. I'm just thankful she doenst teach the entire semester.
No Comments
Kickass prof. very incouraging and easy. Hutchins is the shiznit.
